actions-list.actionItem: The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 2494.
The Speaker designated the Honorable James C. Moylan to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 398 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2494, H.R. 3091 and H. Con. Res. 40. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2494 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; H.R. 3091 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; and H. Con. Res. 40 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 2494 and H.R. 3091.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 398. H.R. 2494 — "To make the assault of a law enforcement officer a deportable offense, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 3091 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Fry moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 4, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Nadler demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 398, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 4.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Rosendale,  numbered 4 printed in Part B of House Report 118-59 to expand the types of weapons officers are allowed to purchase to include all retired firearms.

At the conclusion of debate on the Luttrell amendment No. 3, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Nadler demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 398, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Luttrell amendment No. 3.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Luttrell,  numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 118-59 to allow retired federal law enforcement officers to also be eligible to purchase retired service weapons.

At the conclusion of debate on the McCormick amendment No. 2, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Nadler demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 398, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the McCormick amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Mr. McCormick,  numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report to strike "fair market value" and replace it with "salvage value," which is defined as the value of an asset at the end of its useful life.

At the conclusion of debate on the Jacobs amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Jacobs demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 398, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jacobs amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Jacobs,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-59 to require each federal agency to establish determinations for an officer in good standing.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 3091.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Garcia to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 398 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2494, H.R. 3091 and H. Con. Res. 40. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2494 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; H.R. 3091 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; and H. Con. Res. 40 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 2494 and H.R. 3091.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 398. H.R. 3091 — "To allow Federal law enforcement officers to purchase retired service weapons, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 467 and H.J. Res. 42.
The Chair designated Mr. Schneider to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:000 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Keith Self to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
